definitions: option or possibility to turn to for assistance when in difficulty
legal right to demand payment or compensation from another party
examples: Our only recourse was to contact customer service
They had no recourse but to accept the decision
The contract gives us recourse against the supplier
Investors have limited recourse if the deal fails

definitions: activity done for enjoyment when not working or studying
examples: Swimming is her favorite form of recreation
The park offers many recreation opportunities for families

definitions: person whose job is finding suitable candidates for job positions
examples: The recruiter called about a new opportunity
She works as a recruiter for tech companies

definitions: action of finding and hiring new people for jobs or organizations
examples: The company increased recruitment efforts this year
Military recruitment has declined in recent months

definitions: flat shape with four straight sides and four right angles
examples: Draw a rectangle on the paper first
The room was shaped like a perfect rectangle

definitions: action of putting something right that was wrong or inaccurate through systematic adjustment
examples: The error requires immediate rectification by management
Rectification of the building defects took several months

definitions: electrical device that converts alternating current into direct current by allowing flow in one direction
examples: The power supply needs a new rectifier circuit
This rectifier converts AC voltage to DC voltage

definitions: priest in charge of a parish in certain Christian churches
head of certain universities or colleges especially in Europe
examples: The rector delivered Sunday's sermon at church
She was appointed rector of the parish last year
The university rector welcomed all new students
He served as rector for two consecutive terms

definitions: final section of the large intestine ending at the anus
examples: The doctor examined the patient's rectum carefully
Cancer can develop in the rectum area

definitions: process of returning to normal health after illness or exhaustion through rest
examples: Her recuperation from surgery took several weeks
The athlete needs proper recuperation between training sessions

definitions: fact of something happening again especially at regular intervals or after stopping
examples: Doctors monitor patients for cancer recurrence carefully
The recurrence of flooding concerns local residents greatly

definitions: process of converting waste materials into new materials and objects
examples: The city expanded its recycling program this year
Recycling helps reduce landfill waste and pollution significantly

definitions: process of removing sensitive information from documents before public release
document from which confidential or sensitive information has been removed
examples: The redaction of classified information took several days
Lawyers supervised the redaction process before trial began
The redaction still revealed important facts about events
We received a heavily redacted version yesterday

definitions: person who saves others from sin or evil in religious contexts
someone who compensates for faults or makes amends for bad aspects
examples: Christians believe Jesus Christ is their redeemer
Many religions have concepts of a divine redeemer
He became the redeemer of the family's reputation
The new CEO was seen as the company's redeemer

definitions: action of defining something again or differently to give new meaning or purpose
examples: The company underwent a complete redefinition of goals
Society's redefinition of gender roles continues to evolve

definitions: action of saving or being saved from sin or evil through atonement
action of repaying a loan or recovering something pledged or mortgaged
examples: His story is one of redemption and forgiveness
The character seeks redemption for past mistakes throughout
Early redemption of the mortgage saved them money
Bond redemption occurs at the maturity date specified

definitions: movement of employees or equipment to a new place or role for better use
examples: Staff redeployment helped avoid layoffs during restructuring
The military announced redeployment of troops next month

definitions: action of developing something again especially by renovating buildings or land for new purposes
examples: Urban redevelopment transformed the old industrial district completely
The waterfront redevelopment project will take five years

definitions: flight that travels through the night arriving early morning causing tiredness
reddish reflection from the retina appearing in flash photography
examples: She took the redeye from Los Angeles to New York
Business travelers often book redeye flights to save time
The camera's flash caused redeye in several photos
Modern cameras have redeye reduction features built in

definitions: person who has reddish or auburn colored hair naturally
examples: The actress is a natural redhead with freckles
Redheads often have fair skin that burns easily

definitions: action of discovering something again that was forgotten or ignored previously
examples: The rediscovery of ancient texts excited scholars worldwide
Her rediscovery of painting brought joy back into life

definitions: distribution of something again in a different way typically to achieve greater equality
examples: Wealth redistribution remains a controversial political topic today
The redistribution of resources helped balance regional development

definitions: working-class white person from rural southern United States often seen as having conservative views
examples: The term redneck originally referred to sunburned farmers
Some proudly identify as rednecks embracing rural culture

definitions: action or process of making something smaller or less in amount
examples: Reducing carbon emissions requires global cooperation and commitment
The company focuses on reducing costs without compromising quality

definitions: practice of analyzing complex phenomena by reducing them to interactions of simpler or fundamental parts
examples: Scientific reductionism attempts to explain biology through chemistry
Critics argue reductionism oversimplifies complex human behavior patterns

definitions: dismissal from employment because a position is no longer needed
inclusion of extra components that are not strictly necessary for functioning
examples: Many workers faced redundancy when the factory closed
The company announced redundancies affecting hundred employees nationwide
System redundancy ensures operations continue if components fail
The essay contained too much redundancy and repetition

definitions: very tall evergreen coniferous tree native to California and Oregon coasts
examples: California's redwood forests attract millions of visitors annually
The ancient redwood stood over three hundred feet tall

definitions: tall grass-like plant that grows in wetlands and marshes
thin strip that vibrates to produce sound in certain musical instruments
examples: Reeds grow densely along the riverbank providing wildlife habitat
They harvested reeds to weave traditional baskets and mats
The clarinet reed needs replacing for better sound quality
Saxophone players often carry spare reeds for performances

definitions: ridge of rock or coral at or near the water surface
examples: The coral reef supports diverse marine life ecosystems
Divers explored the reef discovering many colorful fish

definitions: refrigerated shipping container or truck for transporting perishable goods
slang term for a hand-rolled cigarette containing cannabis
examples: The reefer maintained optimal temperature during ocean transport
Fresh produce travels across country in reefer trucks
Police found several reefers during the traffic stop
The term reefer became popular in jazz culture

definitions: cylinder or frame for winding thread, wire, film or fishing line
spool containing a length of film or magnetic tape
lively Scottish or Irish folk dance with spinning movements
examples: He wound the fishing line back onto the reel
The garden hose reel keeps everything organized and tidy
The old movie came on two separate reels
Film reels were standard before digital projection systems
They danced a traditional reel at the wedding reception
The band played several reels during the Celtic festival

definitions: process of being elected again to the same political position
examples: The mayor announced her campaign for reelection today
Presidential reelection campaigns typically begin two years early

definitions: acting out of a past event especially a battle or historical scene
examples: Civil War reenactment attracts thousands of history enthusiasts
The crime reenactment helped investigators understand what happened

definitions: act of entering again especially after leaving or being away
return of a spacecraft or missile into Earth's atmosphere
examples: Her reentry into the workforce required updating skills
The program assists prisoner reentry into society after release
Spacecraft reentry generates extreme heat from atmospheric friction
The capsule's reentry angle must be precisely calculated

definitions: process of considering or examining something again to form a new judgment
examples: The project requires complete reevaluation after budget cuts
Personal reevaluation often follows major life events or changes

definitions: informal term for referee in sports who enforces rules during games
examples: The ref made a controversial call during overtime
Players argued with the ref about the penalty decision

definitions: official who watches a game to ensure rules are followed
person who reviews academic papers or provides character references
examples: The referee showed a red card for dangerous play
Professional referees undergo extensive training before officiating matches
Journal referees provide anonymous feedback on submitted manuscripts
She asked her professor to be a referee for the job

definitions: act of serving as a referee in sports or academic contexts
examples: His refereeing career spanned twenty years of professional soccer
Fair refereeing ensures the integrity of competitive sports matches

definitions: general vote by the electorate on a single political question
examples: The referendum on independence divided the nation sharply
Voters will decide the issue through a referendum next month

definitions: act of directing someone to another person or place for help or information
examples: The doctor gave her a referral to see a specialist
Employee referral programs offer bonuses for successful hires

definitions: new supply of something to replace what has been used up
examples: She ordered a refill of her prescription medication online
The waiter brought coffee refills without being asked

definitions: process of removing impurities or unwanted elements from a substance or improving small details
quality of being elegant, polite, and showing good taste in behavior
examples: The refinement of sugar removes molasses and impurities completely
Product refinement continued through multiple testing phases before launch
Her refinement showed in every gesture and word choice
The restaurant's refinement attracted an upscale clientele regularly

definitions: industrial facility where crude substances are purified and processed into usable products
examples: The oil refinery processes millions of barrels daily
Sugar refinery workers monitor quality throughout the production process

definitions: industrial process of removing impurities from raw materials to create pure products
examples: Metal refining requires extremely high temperatures throughout the process
The refining of petroleum produces gasoline and other products

definitions: replacement or repair of equipment or fittings especially on ships or buildings
examples: The naval vessel underwent complete refit before deployment overseas
Store refit included new fixtures and updated lighting throughout

definitions: object or surface that reflects light, heat, or sound waves back to their source
examples: Bicycle reflectors increase visibility for nighttime safety riding
The telescope's main reflector gathers light from distant stars

definitions: automatic instinctive reaction to a stimulus without conscious thought
examples: The doctor tested her knee reflex with a hammer
His quick reflex saved him from the falling object

definitions: grammatical form where subject and object refer to the same entity
behavior performed automatically without conscious thought or consideration
examples: The reflexive pronoun 'myself' refers back to the subject
Students learned reflexive verbs in their Spanish class today
Her reflexive response to criticism was always defensive immediately
Reflexive thinking patterns can be difficult to change permanently
